author: James Martin
method: To make the bruschetta, heat a griddle pan until hot. Drizzle the bread with the olive oil and griddle on both sides for 2 minutes. To make the sautéed mushrooms, melt the butter in a frying pan, then add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.  Add the mushrooms, double cream, salt and freshly ground black pepper and cook for 5 minutes. To serve, place the slices of brie on the griddled bread and top with the mushroom sauce. Garnish with chopped parsley.
ingredients: 3 thick slices white bread,  3 tbsp olive oil,  100g/3½oz brie, cut into 3 slices,  1 tbsp parsley, chopped, to garnish,  50g/2oz unsalted butter,  ½ onion, finely chopped,  1 clove garlic, finely chopped,  150g/5½oz mushrooms, chopped,  100ml/3½fl oz double cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
